text:
I was born and raised in a small town in the Midwest. Growing up was an idyllic experience for me; I was surrounded by a loving family and a tight knit community of friends. My parents were kind, hard-working people who put their children first. I was the youngest in the family, so I was often spoiled with extra attention.

I remember spending my days playing outside in the sunshine with my siblings, neighbors, and friends. We would go on adventures together, exploring the nearby woods and fields. We would build forts, climb trees, and invent games to pass the time. We were always active and rarely bored.

When I wasn’t outside, I was inside spending time with my family. My mother was a great cook and she would always make sure we had a delicious home-cooked meal. We would sit around the table every night, sharing stories and jokes. I loved spending time with my family, and I think that’s where I developed my sense of humor.

School was a big part of my childhood, too. I was a bright student and I enjoyed learning new things. I was also a little mischievous, so I often got into some kind of trouble. I was the class clown and I was always up for a laugh. I had a lot of friends and we would often stay up late at night, talking and playing pranks on one another.

My weekends were spent with my family, although we would often go out and do something fun. We would go to the movies, the zoo, or the park. I also enjoyed going to church with my family. I found comfort in the familiar hymns and sermons.

As I grew older, I started to explore my own interests. I was always drawn to art and music, so I started taking classes in those subjects. I was also drawn to theater and I began to participate in school and community plays. I found that I could express myself through these forms of art, and I started to develop a passion for it.

My childhood was filled with love and laughter. I have wonderful memories of my family, friends, and activities. I learned a lot from my experiences and I am grateful for the time I had to explore my own interests and passions. Although I am no longer a child, I still carry the lessons I learned from my childhood with me.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, antagonistic, unconscientious, emotionally stable, and closed to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others

(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations

(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
